    • findELF

      public boolean findELF​(java.lang.String st)
      this function finds lettrs e l and f in exist using recursion in a given string and returns true if found otherwise false.
      Parameters:
      st - string in which we check the characters e l and f
      Returns:
      true if exist false otherwise

      charArray - character array
      index - starting index of charArray
      lenght - lenght of the charArray
      Returns:

      lenght - size of charArray
      index - index of current position

    • evaluateExpression

      public static double evaluateExpression​(java.util.Deque<java.lang.String> input, java.lang.String st)
      this function takes an expression and decides whether it is postfix or prefix by using string st and evaluates the expression.
      Parameters:
      input - expression to be evaluated
      st - string which either postfix or prefix
      Returns:
      returns the solved expression as double.

    • prefixEvaluation

      public static double prefixEvaluation​(java.util.Deque<java.lang.String> input, java.lang.String st)
      this function calls a helper function to evaluate the given expression and returns the value to the caller.
      Parameters:
      input - expression to be evaluated
      st - expression type indicator (whether postfix or prefix) in this case prefix
      Returns:
      returns the result

    • postfixEvaluation

      public static double postfixEvaluation​(java.util.Deque<java.lang.String> input, java.lang.String st)
      this function takes an expression in postfix form and calls a helper function to evaluate it
      Parameters:
      input - expression to be evaluated.
      st - expression type indicator (whether postfix of prefix ) in this case postfix
      Returns:
      the final result of expression as double.

    • print2DArray

      public void print2DArray​(int[][] array, int rowIndex, int rowSize, int colIndex, int colSize)
      this function takes a 2D array and it's corrrsponding row colunms indexes and lenghts and prints it's content in spiral order or form using recursion.
      Parameters:
      array - is the 2D array to be printed
      rowIndex - is the row index
      rowSize - is the row size
      colIndex - is the column index
      colSize - is the columns size
